extendedIngredients.name: nuts
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup finely chopped PLANTERS Mixed Nuts

extendedIngredients.name: roasted garlic
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup KRAFT Lite Balsamic Roasted Garlic Vinaigrette Dressing
extendedIngredients.originalName: KRAFT Lite Balsamic Roasted Garlic Vinaigrette Dressing

title: Roasted Garlic and Nut-Crusted Fish
summary: Roasted Garlic and Nut-Crusted Fish is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe with 52 servings. One portion of this dish contains about 2g of protein, 1g of fat, and a total of 15 calories. For 19 cents per serving, this recipe covers 1% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. Head to the store and pick up cilantro, garlic, lite balsamic roasted garlic vinaigrette dressing, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 52 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 34%. This score is not so awesome. Try Garlic-Crusted Cod Fish, Sesame-Crusted Fish Fillets with Garlic-Ginger Sauce, and Olive Tapenade Crusted Chicken and Quinoa with Roasted Garlic, Roasted Red Peppers and Basil for similar recipes.
instructions: Pour dressing over fish in shallow dish; turn to coat both sides of each fillet with dressing. Refrigerate 30 min. to marinate. Meanwhile, combine nuts, cilantro, garlic and oil.                                            Heat oven to 375F.  Remove fish from marinade; discard marinade.  Place fish on baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray.  Top with nut mixture; press lightly into fish to secure.                                              Bake 10 to 12 min. or until fish flakes easily with fork.

steps.step: Pour dressing over fish in shallow dish; turn to coat both sides of each fillet with dressing. Refrigerate 30 min. to marinate. Meanwhile, combine nuts, cilantro, garlic and oil.
Remove fish from marinade; discard marinade.
Place fish on baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray.  Top with nut mixture; press lightly into fish to secure.
Bake 10 to 12 min. or until fish flakes easily with fork.
